item.title: Big Data Homework Caching Mechanism
Intro to Time Series Final Project
item.description: %matplotlib inline import numpy as np import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import statsmodels.api as sm df = pd.read_csv("OilStocks(2).csv", index_col = 0, parse_dates = True) ts = df["CrudeOil"] logOil = np.log(ts) oilReturns = logOil.diff().dropna() oilReturns Date 2015-01-02 -0.010948 2015-01-05 -0.051603 2015-01-06 -0.043081 2015-01-07 0.014910 2015-01-08 0.002874 ... 2019-12-24 0.010537 2019-12-26 0.007668 2019-12-27 -0.000650 2019-12-30 -0.001465 2019-12-31 -0.010478 Name: CrudeOil, Length: 1258, dtype: float64 df['days'] = range(1259) olsmodel = sm.

item.title: Time Series ARIMA Project
item.description: Jiayang Yin This is an R Markdown Notebook. When you execute code within the notebook, the results appear beneath the code. Try executing this chunk by clicking the Run button within the chunk or by placing your cursor inside it and pressing Cmd+Shift+Enter. set.seed(1) noise <- rnorm(100) randwalk <- cumsum(noise) plot(randwalk, type="l") Trying to fit to a particular random walk. Let’s suppose we thought the above random walk was actually given by linear trend plus noise.
